poem:
Title: In The Theater of Politics 

Election's eve is poised, like a ripening pear,
But the taste this year, strangely unfamiliar.
One choice, a sunset rich with seasoned years,
The other, a mirthless jest drawn in courtly fears.
Across screens, echoes Meyers, comedic sage,
In our hands lies an unprecedented page.
An election full of unnerving tales,
Shall we listen and tip justice's scales?
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Seth Meyers on Trump: ‘He’ll have to Zoom in to rallies from the court’ Late-night hosts discuss voter concerns about Joe Biden’s age as Donald Trump faces numerous ongoing trials, with his first criminal trial scheduled for 25 March in New York. Seth Meyers “I don’t think we as a nation have fully grappled yet with just how unprecedented and norm-shattering this election is going to be,” said Seth Meyers on Thursday evening. “One of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
